tools.httpserver
Class HttpServer

java.lang.Object
  tools.httpserver.HttpServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
HttpConstants
public class HttpServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements HttpConstants

Create an HTTP(s) server that can be used for application administration. Switch from http to https requires:

  • generating a SSL key and storing it in a keystore.
  • starting server with switches "-Djavax.net.ssl.trustStore=keystore -Djavax.net.ssl.keyStore=keystore -Djavax.net.ssl.keyStorePassword="password"

Version:
1.0
Author:
k.mittig

          TCP server thread Manages indifferently http/https connections

Only files under this path are directly reachable.

Parameters:
path - Path to HTML files

setBacklog

public void setBacklog(int backlogsize)
Set server socket backlog.
If maximum simultaneous connections are reached, new connections are put in waiting state in backlog.
If backlog becomes full, new connections are rejected.

Parameters:
backlogsize - Backlog size

setThreadNb

public void setThreadNb(int threadsnb)
Set number of supported threads (simultaneous connections allowed).
If threads are all used, new connections fall into backlog

Parameters:
threadsnb - Thread number that the server supports.

Check is given pwd is correct

Parameters:
password - pwd to check, in clear
Returns:
true if it matches server pwd, false otherwise
